[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: key_gen()] [Weak key generation] Can key_gen() produce the identity scalar or other weak keys that make decryption trivial for attackers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Group element sampling] Can rand_element() produce biased group elements that leak information about the plaintext through statistical analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [GCM authentication tag] Is the 128-bit GCM authentication tag sufficient for the security requirements, or can birthday attacks enable forgery after 2^64 operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [AES key truncation] Does Key::from_slice properly use all 32 bytes from the hash output, or can truncation reduce effective key strength below 256 bits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [GCM tag timing] Does AES-GCM tag verification run in constant time, or can timing differences enable forgery through adaptive chosen-ciphertext attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Nonce space exhaustion] Can the 96-bit nonce space be exhausted with the same AES key, and what happens when all nonces are used up? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Associated data] Does the scheme use GCM's associated authenticated data (AAD) feature, and can omission enable context confusion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: hash_group_element_to_aes_key()] [SHA3-256 collisions] Can an attacker find collisions in SHA3-256 to generate different group elements that produce the same AES key, enabling unauthorized decryption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: hash_group_element_to_aes_key()] [Preimage attacks] Can attackers perform preimage attacks on SHA3-256 to find group elements that hash to a known AES key? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: hash_group_element_to_aes_key()] [Second preimage resistance] Is SHA3-256's second preimage resistance sufficient to prevent attackers from finding alternative decryption keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Serialization format] Can the concatenation of [c0|c1|nonce|ciphertext] be ambiguously parsed if component sizes vary, causing decryption to use wrong values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Deserialization bombing] Can attackers craft compressed points that decompress to excessive sizes causing memory exhaustion during decryption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Missing validation] Are all ciphertext components validated before use, or can malformed data cause undefined behavior in curve operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/mod.rs] [Trait: AsymmetricEncryption] [Thread safety] Is the trait implementation thread-safe when multiple threads encrypt/decrypt simultaneously with the same keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [RNG state races] Can concurrent encryptions using shared RNG state cause race conditions that reduce randomness quality or leak key material? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: key_gen()] [Concurrent key generation] Can concurrent key generation on multiple threads from the same RNG cause key collisions or reduced entropy? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Cache timing] Can cache timing differences during scalar multiplication reveal private key bits through repeated decryption measurements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Power analysis] Can power consumption patterns during decryption operations leak private key information through differential power analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Branch prediction] Do conditional branches in is_torsion_free() or point validation create timing variations exploitable through branch prediction attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [EM radiation] Can electromagnetic emanations during encryption operations leak plaintext or key information through TEMPEST-style attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: enc()] [Related-key attacks] Can attackers exploit relationships between public keys to recover private keys or decrypt messages encrypted under related keys? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/asymmetric_encryption/elgamal_curve25519_aes256_gcm.rs] [Function: dec()] [Fault attacks] Can induced computation faults during decryption leak private key bits through fault analysis techniques? (High)
